description:
The `inventory_items` table tracks individual items within the inventory, providing a detailed record of each unit of a product. It includes information on the item's lifecycle, from its creation to when it was sold, along with its cost and associated product details.

This data is primarily used for the following purposes:

* **Inventory Management**: It allows for precise tracking of stock levels, movement of goods, and the status of individual items.
* **Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) Analysis**: By recording the cost of each item when it was sold, this table is crucial for calculating the cost of goods sold and determining profitability.
* **Supply Chain and Fulfillment Analysis**: It helps in understanding the time an item spends in inventory, allowing for optimization of stocking and fulfillment processes.
* **Product-Level Reporting**: The table links back to the `products` and `distribution_centers` tables, enabling a detailed analysis of sales and costs on a per-item basis.

schema.name: id
schema.description: Unique identifier for each individual inventory item. This is the primary key and can be used to join with the `inventory_item_id` in the `order_items` table.

schema.name: product_id
schema.description: The ID of the product associated with this inventory item. This is a foreign key to `products.id`.

schema.name: created_at
schema.description: The timestamp when the inventory item was created.

schema.name: sold_at
schema.description: The timestamp when the inventory item was sold. Null if the item is still in stock.

schema.name: cost
schema.description: The cost of the inventory item.

schema.name: product_category
schema.description: The category of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_name
schema.description: The name of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_brand
schema.description: The brand of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_retail_price
schema.description: The retail price of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_department
schema.description: The department of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_sku
schema.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) of the product this inventory item belongs to.

schema.name: product_distribution_center_id
schema.description: The ID of the distribution center where the inventory item is located. This is a foreign key to `distribution_centers.id`.
